member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SearchResults.DefaultSortOrder
member.summary: The default sort order, in string representation, for normal searches. The primary sort key is the score (descending), the secondary sort key is the use count (descending), and the tertiary sort key is the use date (descending).

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SearchResults.DefaultSortOrderConcordance
member.summary: The default sort order, in string representation, for concordance searches. The primary sort key is the score (descending), the secondary sort key is the change date (descending), and the tertiary sort key is the use count (descending).

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SearchResults.Merge(Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SearchResults,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Appends addtional search results to the current list of search results. Note that other fields, such as the source tokens or the source word count, are not merged (although they may differ for cross-TM searches).
member.param: The search results to merge with the current results.
If true, a heuristics is applied to remove duplicates. The original sort order is preserved, but the multiple translations information is re-evaluated.

member.summary:

All field names are valid if they don't start or end with whitespace.
member.returns: true if the string is a legal identifier, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.Field.LookupSpecialField(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up a special field by its name. Special fields are fields with a predefined name, which may be "virtual" fields (those computed from data at runtime) or "physical" fields (which have an actual value in the data storage). Special field names should not be used for user-defined fields. Note that special fields are a superset of system fields (i.e. not all special fields are system fields).
member.returns: The special (predefined) field, or null if no such special field exists.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified name is reserved for a system (predefined) field.
member.returns: true if the field name is a reserved system field name, and false otherwise

member.summary: Determines whether the name is reserved for system purposes.

member.summary: A Sorter<T> implements the generic IComparer<T> interface to compare two objects of type T, using a caller-supplied sort specification (which includes the fields to consider during sorting, and the sort direction). member.name: T:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SortSpecification
member.summary:
Encapsulates a set of criteria used for sorting translation units.
The order in which the different criteria are added to a sort specification is essential. Only if two translation units are equivalent according to a sort criterium, the next relevant criterium will be considered in order to decide which of the translation units comes first and so on.
The sort specification consists of a collection of SortCriterium objects which in turn may refer to system fields or filter names, and include a specification whether to sort ascending or descending. Typical examples are:
Sco/D UsD/D
which sorts descending by score and descending by last usage date.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance with default values.

member.param: The string containing the serialized form of a sort specification.

member.summary: Adds a new sort criterium to the list.

member.summary: Gets or sets the list of sort criteria.

member.summary: Gets the number of criteria in this sort specification.

member.name: P:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SortSpecification.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the criterium at the specified index in the list.
member.returns: The sort criterium at the given index.

member.name: T:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.EditScripts.Mode
member.summary: Describes the different modes how field values can be changed.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.EditScripts.Mode.Assign
member.summary: The value is assigned as-is to the field. If no value exists yet for the given field, a new field value will be added. This mode is valid for all field types.

summary.para: The value is added to the current field value. If no value is present yet, the value will be assigned.

For multi-valued fields, the existing field values will be joined (set union) with the new value. For Date and Number fields, the value will be added to the existing value. Single-valued text and picklist fields will always be assigned.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.EditScripts.Mode.Substract
member.summary: The value is substracted from the current field value. If no value is present yet, nothing will happen. For multi-valued fields, the value will be set-removed from the existing value. For Date and Number fields, the value will be substracted from the existing value. The mode is invalid for single-valued text and picklist fields.

member.name: T:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.EditScripts.EditActionRenameField
member.summary:
Renames a field or a field's picklist values. System fields cannot be renamed. The subsequent processor needs to know how to handle renamed fields - i.e. an importer would need to be allowed to add new fields on-the-fly unless the TM is already set up. If fields or picklist values are renamed, in-place editing in a UI may fail unless the renamed objects are already defined in the TM's setup.
If a field is renamed but a value with that renamed field value already exists, the original field value will be dropped. Note that the field type will remain as is.
The action can also be used to rename picklist values. If the is non-null, then that mapping will be applied to the values of picklist fields. If you only want to rename the picklist values, but not the field itself, set to the same value as .

member.name: P:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.AtomicExpression.Value
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Value for this atomic expression. This property contains both the left and right operands. The Name property of the field represents the left operand and the Value property represents the right operand.
This property should be set before the operator Op property.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the operator for this atomic expression. Throws an error if the field type is not compatible with a specific operator.

member.name: T:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.FilterExpressionParser
member.summary:
Provides a parser that can read a filter expression from a string and create an equivalent FilterExpression object.
The returned object can be serialized back into an equivalent string, which may not look exactly like the original input. That is because the parser normalizes the input, by surrounding field names and values with double quotes and by adding brackets.
Field names are case insensitive and so are string values.
Picklist values are case sensitive and the parser will throw an error if the expression contains a value not defined by the specified field.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.FilterExpressionParser.Parse(System.String,Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.IFieldDefinitions)
member.summary: Parses the provided , using the provided field declarations, and returns a which corresponds to the expression.
member.param: The field declarations which are in effect, to resolve any field references
member.returns: A filter expression. An exception is thrown if is invalid.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.FilterExpressionParser.#ctor(Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.IFieldDefinitions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with a collection of field declarations.
member.param: The field declarations to use for parsing.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.FilterExpressionParser.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a string expression and returns the equivalent object.
member.returns: The equivalent filter expression. If the string does not represent a valid expression, an exception is thrown.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the limit for the number of tags any TU segment may contain in order to be imported. The default value is . If the limit is exceeded, the TU will not be imported and an error will be generated.
If the value is 0, no limit will be applied.

member.summary: Specifies the penalty type.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.Unknown
member.summary: The penalty type is unknown. Needed for XML serialization in order to avoid confusion between a valid value and a non-existing one.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.TagMismatch
member.summary: Applied multiple times, for each time the TU's tags don't match the search TU's/search segment's tags.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.MemoryTagsDeleted
member.summary: Applied at most once if the memory tags were automatically deleted because the search segment doesn't contain any tags (in which case the TagMismatch penalty will not be applied).

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.TargetSegmentMismatch
member.summary: Applied at most once when the lookup TU's target differs from the TM's.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.FilterPenalty
member.summary: Identifies a penalty which is imposed by a matching filter.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.ProviderPenalty
member.summary: Identifies a constant penalty which is added to all TUs returned by the search provider.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.MultipleTranslations
member.summary: Applied to each exact match if there exist multiple exact matches in a result set.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.AutoLocalization
member.summary: Applied if an auto-localization took place to create the translation proposal. It will only be triggered for auto-substitutions which affect the segment text and are due to auto-localizable tokens. In particular, it will not be triggered for auto-substitutable tags, variables, or text placeholders.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.TextReplacement
member.summary: Applied if an auto-substitution took place to create the translation proposal and the segment text is affected. It will only be triggered for variable auto-substitutions and text placeholders, but not for auto-localizations.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.PenaltyType.Alignment
member.summary: Applied for TUs which come from alignment.

member.summary: A placeable association is a correspondence between two placeables, one in the source segment, and one in the target segment. Either may be null, but not both at the same time. member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SearchResultFieldValueComparer.Compare(Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SearchResult,Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SearchResult,System.String)
member.summary:
Compares two search results' specified field values and returns an indication of their relative values.
Currently only the following field names are allowed: sco (score), usc (usage count), usd (last used date), crd (creation date), chd (change date).
If a field name is used which is not listed above, Compare will return zero.
member.param: The first of the two items to compare.
The second of the two items to compare.
member.returns: Less than zero if a is less than b, zero if a equals b or a value greater than zero if a is greater than b.

member.name: F:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.SearchMode.DuplicateSearch
member.summary: Performs a search on the source and target hashes for duplicate search during import (only used internally).

member.summary: Repositions the iterator at the beginning of the translation memory.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the filter used by this iterator.
Only translation units satisfying this filter will be returned.

member.name: P:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationMemoryIterator.MaxCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of translation units that this iterator will return to the caller in one step.

member.name: P:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationMemoryIterator.MaxScan
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum number of translation units that this iterator will retrieve from the TM in one step. If 0, the number will be unlimited. Note that while limits the number of TUs returned to the caller, limits the number of TUs retrieved from the storage. This facilitates cancellation and progress reporting in cases where the iterator's filter conditions require many (or all) TUs retrieved from the storage to fill the result set.
Since TUs are retrieved from storage in batches of size , the number of scanned TUs in one iteration may actually be larger than the value.

member.name: P:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationMemoryIterator.ProcessedTranslationUnits
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of translation units processed by this iterator since its creation.

member.name: P:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationMemoryIterator.ScannedTranslationUnits
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of translation units processed by this iterator in the last roundtrip.

member.name: P:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationMemoryIterator.Forward
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this iterator is moving forward or backward to retrieve the next page of translation units.

member.name: T:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.RegularIterator
member.summary:
Represents a regular iterator that can retrieve all the translation units from a translation memory page by page.
The iterator can have a filter, in which case it will only return those translation units that match the filter.
The default page for this iterator is 100 translation units.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance with default values.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.RegularIterator.#ctor(System.Int32)

member.summary: See

member.name: P:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.RegularIterator.PositionFrom
member.summary:
Gets or sets the starting position of the current page in this iterator.
The page starts at the first translation unit AFTER this position.

member.name: P:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.RegularIterator.PositionTo
member.summary:
Gets or sets the last position of the current page in this iterator.
The page ends at this position, inclusively.

member.name: T:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.DuplicateIterator
member.summary:
Represents a duplicate translation units search iterator.
After the iterator is created, it is set to start searching from the beginning of the translation memory. This instance is passed to the API, which modifies it, by annotating the current position reached and passes it back to the caller, to be used in a subsequent call.
This object should never be modified manually.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.DuplicateIterator.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance.
The iterator is positioned at the beginning of the translation memory.
Since the translation memory is not a sorted set of translation units, the order is storage specific and should not be relied upon, outside the implementation of the iterator.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationUnit.GetValue(System.String)
member.summary:
Retrieves the value of a specified field from this translation unit.
The system fields can be retrieved using the following names:
Name Corresponding System Field
chdChange date
chuChange user
usdLast used date
usuLast used user
uscUsage counter
crdCreation date
cruCreation user
Pseudo-fields contain values that are not saved as separate field values, but can be computed from the existing information in a translatin unit. The available pseudo-fields are:
Name Corresponding Pseudo-field
srcSource segment (including tags).
trgTarget segment (including tags)
sourceplainlengthThe length of the plain text in the source segment (without tags)
targetplainlengthThe length of the plain text in the target segment (without tags)
member.returns: The corresponding field value or null if such a field does not exist.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationUnit.SetValue(Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.FieldValue,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets the value of the specified field, which can be a system field or a user field. Pseudo fields (such as src, trg, soruceplainlength, etc.) can not be set.
Exceptions will be thrown if the field types are incompatible.
member.param: The new field value, including the field name.
If true, a new field value is added to the current list of values if no previous value is present.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationUnit.GetValue(System.String,Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.FieldValueType)
member.summary: Retrieves the field value with the specified type from this translation unit.
member.returns: The corresponding field value, null if a field with the specified name does not exist or an error if the type does not match the result.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationUnit.GetSystemFieldType(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the field value type for known system and pseudo fields.
member.returns: The field type, or if the field is not a known system or pseudo field.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.TranslationUnit.GetType(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the type of the specified field.
member.returns: The corresponding type or Unknown if a field with such name does not exist.

member.summary: Represents the result of a word count.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.WordCounts.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with default values. All counts will be set to 0.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.WordCounts.#ctor(Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.WordCounts)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance with the values of another instance, creating a deep copy.

member.name: M:Sdl.LanguagePlatform.TranslationMemory.WordCounts.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Sdl.LanguagePlatform.Core.Tokenization.Token})
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance from the values in the provided token collection.
Word and abbreviation tokens increment the character count by the length of the token text and increment the word count by one,
Char sequence tokens (used in far-east tokenization) increment the word and character count by the length of the token text,
Punctuation tokens only increment the character count, by the length of the token text,
Date, time, variable, number, measurement, acronym, uri, and other text placeable tokens increment the word and character count like words do, but also increment the placeables count,
Tag tokens increment the tag and placeable counts, but not the word or character counts,
Whitespace tokens do not increment any counts (even not the character count),
All other token types do not increment any counts.
The segment count is set to 1, independent on the number and type of the tokens.

member.returns: A new instance that is a deep copy of this instance.
